docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Groups that favor giving workers unpaid leave to care for newborn babies and ailing relatives are preparing to lobby individual states for legislation to do what a Federal bill vetoed by President Bush would have done.

headline.main: Battle for Family Leave Will Be Fought in States

docs.snippet: LEAD: Groups that favor giving workers unpaid leave to care for newborn babies and ailing relatives are preparing to lobby individual states for legislation to do what a Federal bill vetoed by President Bush would have done.

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: The RJR Nabisco Holdings Corporation, the parent of the tobacco-and-food giant that recently refinanced part of history's largest leveraged buyout, yesterday announced a loss of $108 million for the second quarter, compared with a loss of $319 million in the comparable period last year. The improved performance exceeded analysts' expectations.

headline.main: RJR Nabisco's Parent Posts $108 Million Loss for Quarter

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: A SEAT on a board of directors has always been one of the ultimate signs of achievement. Increasingly, the doors to the boardrooms of major corporations and foundations have been swinging open to admit women.

headline.main: Getting Close to Nature in Montana More Women Gaining Entry To Boardroom

docs.snippet: LEAD: A SEAT on a board of directors has always been one of the ultimate signs of achievement. Increasingly, the doors to the boardrooms of major corporations and foundations have been swinging open to admit women.

byline.original: By ANDREW H. MALCOLM; ANDREW H. MALCOLM is national affairs correspondent of The New York Times.  By JOAN M. LANG
